content.text: December. weare.esaps.net went live.
Shen Muchuan opened the site in her room. Music played in her headphones. A half-finished sketch sat by her hand.
She clicked into the character pages.
1547's page, yellow. 1548's page, pink. 1549's page, blue. The palettes, typography, card styles, and motion transitions on each page were all her work.

From September to December, she submitted many design versions. Most were drawn late at night, some before dawn. Every version was a little better than the previous one, but she had never considered any version perfect.
Now she saw them become real pages, running in browsers, viewed by real people...
She did not feel anything dramatic.
Just a quiet satisfaction. Like those few seconds after finishing a drawing and leaning back in your chair. You do not need anyone else to tell you whether it is good. You already know.
The group chat was celebrating.
2275 sent a string of exclamation marks. 1738 said, "Thanks, everyone." 1547 posted a screenshot of commit logs: 215 commits, 16 contributors. 1548 sent a single "。"
Shen Muchuan watched the messages scroll. She typed a few words, deleted them, typed again, deleted again.
In the end, she sent one character.
Mm.
Then she closed the chat window.
That evening, 1548 sent her a private message.
The character pages turned out well.
Shen Muchuan looked at the message. Hearing "well done" from 1548 was roughly equivalent to hearing "that's amazing" from anyone else.
Could still be better.
Then keep improving.
Shen Muchuan smiled. A very small smile, seen by no one.
She casually opened her private folder.
The earliest drawing was still there. Spring 2024. Two people, with a large blank space between them. She paused on it for three seconds.
Then she closed the folder.
She reopened the canvas and put on her headphones.
A new sketch was on the screen. Still blank. But she knew what it would become.

I prefer speaking through visuals.
Not because I can't speak.
Because visuals are more honest than language.
